description:
Anoxybacillus pushchinoensis is a species of bacteria that belongs to the genus Anoxybacillus. It is a spore-forming, aerobic, and thermophilic bacterium, meaning it can grow and thrive in the absence of oxygen and at high temperatures.

The cells of Anoxybacillus pushchinoensis are rod-shaped and typically measure between 0.5-0.7 micrometers in width and 2.0-4.0 micrometers in length. The bacterium is capable of forming endospores, which are dormant structures that allow the organism to survive under unfavorable environmental conditions.

Anoxybacillus pushchinoensis was first isolated from a soil sample collected in Pushchino, Russia. It is known to grow optimally at temperatures ranging from 50°C to 65°C and can tolerate a wide range of pH levels, from 6.0 to 9.5.

This species is of scientific interest due to its potential applications in biotechnology, such as the production of thermostable enzymes and the degradation of complex organic compounds. Further research on Anoxybacillus pushchinoensis may provide insights into the adaptations of thermophilic bacteria to extreme environmental conditions.
